bbc.title: Norway's PM agrees crown princess had 'poor judgement' over Epstein links
bbc.description: Jonas Gahr Støre says he agreed with Princess Mette-Marit's own remarks over her contacts with the late sex offender.

bbc.title: 'Do you think you're the devil himself?' Epstein questioned in newly released interview
bbc.description: The footage, which is part of millions of files released by the US Department of Justice, shows the late sex offender being questioned by an unnamed interviewer.

bbc.title: Syria's only female minister pushes for change: 'I'm not here for window dressing'
bbc.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet follows Hind Kabawat as she confronts the challenges of fragmented, post-Assad Syria.

bbc.title: Bad Bunny makes Grammy history as he wins best album
bbc.description: Other prizes went to Billie Eilish, Olivia Dean and Lady Gaga, at a ceremony dominated by politics.

bbc.title: Golden becomes the first K-Pop song to win a Grammy
bbc.description: The Cure, Yungblud and FKA Twigs are the first British winners on the night in Los Angeles.

bbc.title: Kennedy Center to close for two years for renovations, Trump says
bbc.description: The move follows several artists cancelling performances at the storied institution after it was recently renamed as the Trump Kennedy Center.

bbc.title: Twelve miners killed by Russian strike in Ukraine, officials say
bbc.description: Fifteen others were reported injured in the strike near a bus carrying the workers on Sunday.

bbc.title: China executes four more Myanmar mafia members
bbc.description: China has executed four members of the Bai family mafia, which ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: Gold, Silver Slump With Stocks in Volatile Trading: Markets Wrap
bloomberg.description: Gold and silver extended their slump with stocks, as assets that had performed the best in January came under intense selling pressure following Friday’s dramatic market reversal.

bloomberg.title: Korea’s World-Beating Stock Rally Stumbles as Risk-Off Wave Hits

bloomberg.description: World Gold Council strategist John Reade explains the perfect storm that’s turning gold into a preferred safe haven.

bloomberg.title: How to Calculate the True Value of Gold | Merryn Talks Money

bloomberg.title: India’s Record Borrowing Plan Drives Yields to One-Year High
bloomberg.description: India’s benchmark bond yields climbed to the highest in more than a year after the government unveiled a record debt-sale plan that exceeded analysts’ expectations.

bloomberg.title: Millennial Anti-Gang Hardliner Elected Costa Rican President

bloomberg.title: Modi Aims at Trump’s Threats With Budget to Shield India
bloomberg.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s plan to protect India’s economy from Donald Trump’s tariffs is coming into sharper focus.

bloomberg.title: Japan LNG Buyers Skip Qatar Conference on Security Concerns
bloomberg.description: Some of Japan’s major liquefied natural gas buyers said they will skip a key conference in Qatar, as tensions between Iran and the US threaten to spill over to the wider region.

bloomberg.title: Britain’s Growing Ranks of Jobless Men Are Flocking to Farage
bloomberg.description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK party is appealing to a growing group of voters ahead of a crucial special election this month: men without a job.

bloomberg.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping’s pledge to curb financial risks and build a powerful currency with global reserve status, reiterated in a state publication, is boosting expectations of an accelerated pu

bloomberg.title: Sara Duterte Impeachment Bids Revived as One-Year Reprieve Ends
bloomberg.description: Two new impeachment complaints were filed against Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte on Monday, reviving efforts to oust her as a year-long ban on such measures expires.
